meanings.definition: A wooden pin used for fastening things together.
meanings.sent1: I found a sturdy dowl to fix the broken chair leg.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter inserted the dowl into the joint to strengthen it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the dowl for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a dowl, holding the team together through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The dowl, with its simple design, proved to be the perfect solution for the wobbly table.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a wooden pin.
meanings.sent1: Please dowl the two pieces of wood together to make a sturdy frame.
meanings.sent2: He carefully dowled the shelf to the wall to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to dowl the pieces of the broken wand back together.
meanings.sent4: Her words dowled their friendship, creating a bond that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The idea dowled in his mind, connecting all the pieces of the puzzle.
